Name: Deductive Reasoning - PE
Text: First I should recall the usual sequence of events in a P2P process Normally it starts with creating a purchase requisition PR then approving it After approval a purchase order PO is issued to the vendor The vendor sends the goods which are then received The vendor also sends an invoice The invoice needs to be matched against the PO and possibly the receipt of goods to ensure everything is correct Once verified the payment is released Finally the case is closed

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Starting with Case 1001 The sequence is Create PR Approve PR Issue PO Receive Goods Vendor Invoice Received Match Invoice to PO Release Payment Close Case That looks perfectly in line with the standard process So no anomalies here

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Next Case 1002 The activities are Create PR Issue PO without approval in between then Vendor Invoice Received Release Payment then Approve PR Receive Goods Match Invoice Close Wait thats out of order Normally the PR should be approved before issuing the PO Here the PO was issued right after creating the PR without approval Then after receiving the invoice and releasing payment the approval happened Thats a big problem Approval is supposed to happen before the PO is issued Also receiving goods comes after the payment was released which doesnt make sense Goods should be received before payment So Case 1002 has multiple anomalies

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 1003 Create PR Approve PR Issue PO Release Payment Vendor Invoice Received Receive Goods Match Invoice Close Here Release Payment happens before the vendor invoice is received and goods are received Thats an issue because payment shouldnt be released until after the invoice is verified and goods are received So payment was released too early

Name: Pattern Recognition - PE
Text: Case 1004 Create PR Approve PR Receive Goods Issue PO Vendor Invoice Received Match Invoice Release Payment Close Wait here Goods are Received before the PO is even issued Thats impossible You cant receive goods without having issued a PO first The PO is the instruction to the vendor to supply the goods So receiving goods before PO is a major anomaly Also the PO was issued after receiving goods which doesnt make sense The correct order should be PR approved PO issued then goods received

Name: Inductive Reasoning - PE
Text: So summarizing Case 1002 Missing approval before PO approval after payment goods received after payment Case 1003 Payment released before invoice and goods receipt Case 1004 Goods received before PO issued PO issued after goods arrival

Name: Abductive Reasoning - PE
Text: Now why are these problematic For Case 1002 skipping approval could lead to unauthorized purchases Approving after the fact is not proper Also paying before goods are received could lead to paying for undelivered items Receiving goods after payment is risky as you might have paid without verifying receipt Case 1003 Releasing payment before receiving goods or invoice means paying without confirmation of delivery risking fraud or errors Case 1004 Receiving goods without a PO could be unauthorized and makes matching with invoices difficult Issuing PO after receipt is irregular and may lead to compliance issues or incorrect accounting

Name: Validation - PE
Text: I need to make sure I didnt miss any other cases Let me doublecheck Case 1001 is normal Cases 1002 1003 1004 have issues as outlined Let me confirm the sequences again Yes Case 1002s approval is after payment and goods receipt which is way out of order Case 1003 pays before invoice and goods Case 1004s PO comes after goods which is impossible in standard process So these three cases have anomalies
